channel.title: "Remove this release"
channel.description:
I'm getting sick of seeing this (not that common on here, but it is on other sites), everyone wants them to remove any halfway decent releases. Their best argument is that people will leech it, witch they will, and post it on the status page.
Although this is true, you have to face some facts.
1. Some projects are open-source meaning everyone has access to the source code, this is to help make the quality of servers in general better. It's much better to see servers that have some decent and fairly working content over the servers we have now. 90% of servers today are actually like allot of the gaming whores on Youtube, they just shit out half-assed content to soak up cash off it. I know better quality servers won't help this issue, but there's nothing you can do. I at least want to logg into a small community that has some decent working code over the shit on the toplists now.
2. If one server's code is better than some of your server's code, don't ask for it to be removed. Why? Because the source code is right fucking there, you can take it if it's really that necessary. You have one thing the leechers won't, a player base, meaning people will probably stick with yours anyway.
3. If you don't want your code being leaked or released, don't give it out to everyone. Plain and simple. If you value your code that much, don't give it to people you don't even know (People on MSN or Skype don't count, I'm talking real-life friends). You know it's probably going to happen, with people being so unpredictable. So why not save the moderators the hassle and not put it in someone Else's server anyway?
4. Everyone deserves to have their own server. If everyone kept all their code to themselves, servers would be non-existent. Mopar's status page actually makes money off the sponsored servers list (no shit), and if he didn't, I seriously doubt he would be hosting it. If we didn't have such a large abundance of servers, the status page wouldn't be there, meaning no advertising. In fact, most people get into RSPS because they are directed to a leech and then find this site.
/rant

item.title: "Remove this release"
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

the elve age:

Whats up with all the pointless topics. I don’t understand at all what this will accomplish. If you haven’t noticed the people still in the RS2 server part of the forums rarely come to general discussion.

Venting off anger is barley pointless to me. As well as it’s pointless to request that a release be taken down because it has your code in it, when your the one that gave them your work with open arms.

pk2play:

tl;dr no one cares.

K

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:14, topic:439674”]I support open source code to be honest. The only way the leechers are even remotely going to learn the BASICS of any language is to at least have to download it and open/search for certain things that they want to edit.

When I was a leecher long time ago I did learn the basics like what a boolean is, how classes and packaging is done, etc.

We all start somewhere. When I see that somebody has at least attempted something then they do deserve that much credit.[/quote]
I do too, it helps other learn, everything I’ve learned in Java is from reading Snippets, Tutorials, and reading the source of random servers.

Miss Silabsoft:

actually mitb is one of the few people that does not profit off the server status page. He has the money for development if anyone takes the time to release something worthwhile you can earn yourself part of that money.

I don’t know a huge amount about the status page, but what I was trying to say is that if there’s nothing that came out of it and it would just lagg the host, do you think he would even have it up?

Read full topic

If you haven’t noticed the people still in the RS2 server part of the forums rarely come to general discussion.[/quote]Irrelevant sort of. The ones who don’t go to general discussion are the leech0rz and such so they want it released anyway. This is a topic about those who say they wish the owner would remove it.

item.title: "Remove this release"
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

I never twisted your words around? I know there’s not much we can do, but that should never stop discussion. That and I wanted to vent off some anger as I had people over without notice and had to listen to Bluegrass music though a wall for 5 hours, so forgive me if I sound pissed.

item.title: "Remove this release"
item.dc:creator: @Acorn1 Acorn_
item.description:
@Acorn1 wrote:

[quote=“JavaTC, post:5, topic:439674”][quote author=Acorn_ link=topic=542368.msg3974221#msg3974221 date=1334468216]

What do you propose we do about it?
This isn’t nazi germany.

I never said to do anything, nor did I say we could, I’m just sick of people bitching “OMFG THIS IS BETTER THAN MINE, TAKE IT DOWN OR I’LL HACK U!!!1111!!1!!!1!1!”

And no it isn’t, but they’re trying to turn it into it clearly by trying to remove anything better than theirs.

So basically you’re saying this rant is pointless?
err…
[/quote]
Just something I wanted to say and see if anyone else who gets on R-S agrees with me. Rants don’t have to change something from my knowledge, I just anted to say something about it because no one else is. Mods can delete it if I’m really that evil for making this topic, because it’s like I make them so often[/quote]
You’re twisting my words into something their not. The reason nobody is saying anything about it because there’s nothing to do about it.

Read full topic
